name: lastlarf
text: It's interesting that Nightlife turns up in this story. Was Onstad considering introducing him as a full time supporting character?

name: remotevinyl
text: Shit, you're right. I never even noticed that before.

name: idsyen
text: If only he would've become a main character! I love Nightlife. I keep hoping he'll show up again. It's been a long time, though. I should probably give up. But you never know...

name: scorpio_nadir
text: It's an uncredited cameo. Nightlife's doing a movie with another studio, and they were shooting next door.

name: theloneliestmonkey
text: Nightlife is also in the crowd welcoming Ray and Roast Beef back from the Great Outdoor Fight.

name: wolfslice
text: nice spot!

name: jstegall
text: Maybe he knew he was going to drop the character from rotation and thought it would be funny to just make him pop up for no reason in a pitch-black dumbwaiter, but that's just what I thought.

name: cousinted
text: A comment left by cousinted was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by BillyLK, Sneakernets, VictoriaW, jmmfgd)

name: ttagxamm
text: It's a pity we can't get Jack Kirby to draw The New Adventures of Nightlife Mingus.

name: redion
text: good god, that would be the bee's knees. someone needs to go resurrect/de-ageify the King.

name: mikekitchell
text: I don't know what 'Space Europe' is but it sounds really, really hell of radical.

name: clockworkorange
text: T.S. Elliot is there. Of course it's radical.

name: murtz
text: Space Europe? Probably Europa, one of Jupiter's moons. Place is covered by miles and miles of ice, which serves as a testament to its badassery.

name: mnemodomi
text:
there is a huge difference between SPACE EUROPE and dumb old europa dude

space europe is both steeped in history and covered in flashing lights and it's got the best dehydrated food ever

name: i_love_kate
text: Just like there is a huge difference between T.S. Elliot and T.S. Eliot.

name: boredom_man
text: you could say it is a Wasteland

name: cailetshadow
text: Careful man. The Eiffel Tower shoots lasers.

name: epicurus
text: By my reckoning, 80% of the chubbies have to be for the last idea. But then again I have a well-documented bias toward crime fighting gay blacksmiths.

name: ovenface
text: Cousinted, you are a rad dude. I like the things you say.

name: snowman
text: Is he a rad enough dude to save the president??

name: kelsotimebomb
text: HA.

name: mattylite
text: My chubby was for space Europe.  Space Europe.  Man, space europe.  The more I say it the more I want to go there.

name: mattylite
text: In space Europe, no one can hear you scream about the hell of tasty croissants.

name: kelsotimebomb
text: In Space Europe, no one can hear you when you're hella yellin' about the sex.

name: tellumo
text: Doesn't that kinda defeat the point of doing so?

name: tekende
text: In Space Europe no one can hear tellumo point out logical fallacies!

name: sneakernets
text: damn touchpad made me mark this lame.

name: fielding
text: You don't get to choose who you are stuck in a pitch-black dumbwaiter with.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: E.g. Nice Pete

name: charchar
text: Nice Pete looks asleep or dead or severely concussed.

name: terrordactyl
text: the scariest part is that nice pete is in there too

name: daidai
text: No the scariest part is that Nice Pete was there before they had the idea to watch a movie

name: nonword
text: this is one of my favorite achewood moments just for the look on beef's face. genius that beef would choose that expression in the pitch black - and that he'd initiate the conversation

name: darthemed
text: And even in the dark, Lyle's face is an expression of rage.

name: agika
text: A comment left by agika was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nighttoad, Overmedicated, Thorfinn, Darthemed)

name: aarongstock
text: ALT TEXT: The fountain would be beautiful, it would be at least 20' tall.

name: tekende
text: Something about the construction of that sentence is really funny to me. It's the incorrectly used comma that does it.

name: chaesar
text:
So Beef did cocaine but never smoked pot before Nightlife gave him some? The man just shits on gateway drugs is what.

A waterfall would dominate.

name: featurelessvoid
text: The best part is that after taking it and becoming ten kinds of uninhibited, Roast Beef gave into his baser instincts and... wrote some code .

name: bixschmix
text: Not just wrote some code, but 1. wrote some code, 2. wrote some code that he thought was good enough to come back to the next day, and 3. wrote some code that ended up being not just gibberish, but a business plan. Oh, Beef. He is the Man who gets things Done.

name: em2
text: Yes, but I do believe the official title is taken by Ray.

name: centipede_damascus
text: I get the impression that Ray made Roast Beef do cocaine.

name: gompo
text: Unlikely, considering how Ray feels cocaine leads to HIV.

name: tekende
text: but whatever you know he wasn't busy

name: never_die
text: Beef is much calmer in the dark.

name: morganization
text: doing cocaine makes you kind of italian, like in the mob or something?

name: geysershitdick
text: A comment left by geysershitdick was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Ebessan, aquamuffin, aperson)

name: estutius
text: Terribly delicious chemical taste, more like!

name: tellumo
text: I have not done cocaine, but I can believe this.

name: foetus_punch
text: I feels like there is metal being poured down your throat and up your nose and onto your gums. I took cocaine, and it didn't affect me beyond that feeling until I took a large, heavy tree branch to a friend's head on a whim, remembering when he had once wronged me. Cocaine is not a good drug. Do not take cocaine.

name: expellens
text: I would rather take four shits and die than try that cocaine!

name: envika
text: if i took cocaine i would take four shits and die

name: greenkoolayd
text: ive heard the same thing about adderall.  i beleive the kid referred to it as 'candy drip'.

name: epicurus
text: I love this strip because of how hilarious it is to look at code you wrote only to find it is, of all things, a business plan for a theme restaurant.

name: achewoodno1fan
text: A comment left by achewoodno1fan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, Thorfinn, mortshire, luckypyjamas, STUART, Darthemed)

name: qatipay
text: Yeah, how many are in there? I count 8 so far...

name: lrosetw8
text: I hadn't even noticed Nice Pete, haha!

name: patkun
text: Well, they are all like a foot tall. Of course, the house is built to cat scale, I guess...or is it?

name: cdl146
text: Why is Teodors hair done all Archie style in the dumbwaiter?

name: philosophe
text: In fact, it is not Archie Style , but in fact Grandmother Style

name: molesticide
text: fact!

name: nice_enuf_guy
text: Who is the narrator in this strip? I believe T,C and NP are asleep!

name: stuart
text: Mr. Bear's awake.

name: snoozebar
text: Also the "Diary Strip: Cornelius Bear" up there at the top.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Ha, for a while I just thought Teodor was very angry.

name: dougthehead
text: Nah, just in the middle of packing a hot lunch, most likely.

name: small
text: Coke always seems like a good idea when your wasted but of course you always forget about the throat drip. Grim.

name: dasilodavi
text: When I was in high school we had a friend with an awesome house that we used to crash whenever.  Sometimes he wasn't there.  It makes me wonder if he too was time-travelling while we played The Sims on his computer.

name: salo
text: no one asked if Roast Beef had done any cocaine

name: wulvaine
text: Correction: No one asked if Roast Beef had done those cocaines.

name: salo
text: I stand corrected.

name: diggydow
text: Why does Teodor have hair in this strip?

name: aseidel
text: I'm actually shocked Lyle doesn't enjoy his coke

name: greenkoolayd
text:
its because the cans hurt his nose.

(i officially self-lame
feel free to do the same)
